path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/Techrate/Nomen Finance Full Smart Contract Security Audit.pdf

findings.title: Owner can change tax and liquidity fees
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to modify tax and liquidity fees.

findings.title: Owner can change maximum transaction amount
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to modify the maximum transaction amount, which could lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Owner can exclude from the fee
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to exclude certain addresses or users from paying fees.

findings.title: Owner can change marketingDivisor
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to modify the marketing divisor.

findings.title: Owner can change minimum number of tokens to add to liquidity
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to modify the minimum number of tokens required to add liquidity.

findings.title: Owner can change buyBackUpperLimit
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to modify the buyBackUpperLimit, which could lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Owner can change marketing address
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to modify the marketing address, which could lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Owner can enable and disable buyBack
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to enable or disable the buyback feature.

findings.title: Owner can enable before and after presale modes
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to enable or disable presale modes, which could lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Owner can withdraw ERC20 tokens to 0xAE36376eD8c27dE5AeC80F84c482Ae5E23c07077 address
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to withdraw ERC20 tokens to a specific address, which could lead to unauthorized token transfer.

findings.title: Owner can lock and unlock, potentially retaking privileges even after ownership was renounced
findings.description: The owner has the ability to lock and unlock, which could allow them to regain control of the contract even after ownership has been renounced.

findings.title: Unprotected functions
findings.description: The following functions are unprotected: tokenFromReflection, excludeFromReward, includeInReward, _approve, _transfer, swapTokens, buyBackTokens, swapTokensForEth, swapETHForTokens, addLiquidity, _tokenTransfer, _transferStandard, _transferToExcluded, _transferFromExcluded, _transferBothExcluded, _reflectFee, _getValues, _getTValues, _getRValues, _getRate, _getCurrentSupply, _takeLiquidity, calculateTaxFee, calculateLiquidityFee, removeAllFee

findings.title: Unprotected public functions: isExcludedFromFee, excludeFromFee, includeInFee, setTaxFeePercent, setLiquidityFeePercent, setMaxTxAmount
findings.description: The functions isExcludedFromFee, excludeFromFee, includeInFee, setTaxFeePercent, setLiquidityFeePercent, and setMaxTxAmount are unprotected public functions.
